info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CATAWBA AND NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Conover, Claremont, Catawba, Bandys, Sherrills Ford, and Startown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
